words.definition: The altitude of a place is its height above sea level.
words.example: The air was thin at such a high altitude on the mountain.

words.definition: A coastline is the outline of a country’s coast.
words.example: He noticed that most of the cities in Australia are on the coastline.

words.definition: To deter means to prevent or discourage someone from doing something.
words.example: Icy roads deter people from driving their cars.

words.definition: To devise something means to have an idea or plan about it in the mind.
words.example: The kids devised a plan to get their parents to buy them a puppy.

words.definition: Expertise is the knowledge and skills to do something well.
words.example: John has a lot of expertise in fixing cars.

words.definition: A fracture is a crack or break in something, especially a bone.
words.example: The fracture in his arm took several weeks to heal.

words.definition: To impair something means to damage it or make it worse.
words.example: Drinking coffee can impair your ability to go to sleep.

words.definition: To implement something means to ensure that what has been planned is done.
words.example: The government implemented a new law about driving safety.

words.definition: Indigenous means that something or someone exists naturally in a specific place.
words.example: Cacti are indigenous to the American southwest.

words.definition: Insight is a deep and accurate understanding of something.
words.example: The book gave me a lot of insight into the lives of ancient people.

words.definition: A limb is a large arm or leg of a person or animal.
words.example: The monkey used its limbs to climb up the tree.

words.definition: A migraine is a very bad headache that can make one feel sick.
words.example: My mother gets a migraine every time she has a lot of stress.

words.definition: Optimism is the feeling of being hopeful about the future or success of something.
words.example: The man’s optimism helped him get through the hard times.

words.definition: When something is peculiar, it is strange, sometimes in a bad way.
words.example: That cake has a peculiar taste—are you sure it’s fresh?

words.definition: When a person is proficient at something, they are very good at it.
words.example: The proficient pianist played the song perfectly.

words.definition: A quest is a long and difficult search for something.
words.example: The knights went on a quest to find the lost treasure.

words.definition: A ridge is a long, narrow piece of raised land.
words.example: The campers hiked along the ridge of the mountain.

words.definition: A spouse is the person to whom someone is married.
words.example: Jane and her spouse went on a vacation to Mexico.

words.definition: To thrust means to push or move something quickly with a lot of force.
words.example: The man thrust the money into his pocket.

words.definition: To tolerate something means to be able to accept it even if it is unpleasant.
words.example: When you live in a city, you must learn to tolerate a lot of noise.
